com.risk.model.Strategy

Class Random

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.risk.model.Strategy.Random
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IStrategy

    public class Random
extends java.lang.Object
implements IStrategy
    Concrete implementation of Random Strategy in terms of Strategy design Pattern, during our GamePlay.
    Version:
    0.0.3
    Author:
    Zinnia Rana, Mayank Jariwala Functions Modifications done by Mayank Jariwala

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Random() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GamePlay attack(GamePlay game_play)
      Attack for a Random Player as per Strategy Design Pattern.This player attacks a random number of times a random country.
      GamePlay fortify(GamePlay game_play)
      Fortify for a Random Player as per Strategy Design Pattern.This function is use by random player to fortify armies from source to territory by selecting random source and any of its random neighbors
      GamePlay reinforce(GamePlay game_play)
      Reinforce for a Random Player as per Strategy Design Pattern.This function is use by random player to reinforce armies on any randomly selected territory with given army stock

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • reinforce

        public GamePlay reinforce(GamePlay game_play)
        Reinforce for a Random Player as per Strategy Design Pattern.This function is use by random player to reinforce armies on any randomly selected territory with given army stock
        Specified by:
        reinforce in interface IStrategy
        Parameters:
        game_play - state of the game i.e. entire game related info when reinforcement starts for a player.
        Returns:
        GamePlay updated state of the game after reinforcement phase ends.
        See Also:
        IStrategy.reinforce(com.risk.model.GamePlay)
